intro: Ouratea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface. The fruit is a small, two-valved capsule that releases seeds when mature.
